oai_dc:dc.dc:title: John Coffee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Painted portrait of John Coffee (1772 -1833) in an ornate from. He wears a dark coat and light vest, collar, and necktie. Hangs at the Hermitage, home of Andrew Jackson

General, War of 1812 and early Nashville settler and surveyor. Portrait was purchased from Terry Tomlin on Aug. 12, 1949 by the Tennessee State Library and presented to the Tennessee Historical Society on Sept. 16, 1949.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Coffee, John, 1772-1833
Coffee, John, 1772-1833;Creek War, 1813-1814;United States. Indian Removal Act of 1830
Generals;Surveyors;Pioneers
